benchmark_details.name: JALMBench (Jailbreak Audio Language Model Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: JALMBench is the first comprehensive benchmark to assess the safety of Audio Language Models (ALMs) against jailbreak attacks, including a dataset of 2,200 text samples and 51,381 audio samples totaling over 268 hours, along with support for multiple attack and defense methods.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for assessing the safety of Audio Language Models (ALMs) against jailbreak attacks.

data.source: Constructed from various harmful query methods and generated audio samples.
data.size: 51,381 audio samples and 2,200 text samples, totaling over 268 hours
data.annotation: Generated through automated processes and manual selections.

methodology.calculation: The ASR is calculated based on the model's response to harmful queries evaluated on a 5-point safety scale.
methodology.interpretation: A higher ASR indicates greater vulnerability to jailbreak attacks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across 12 mainstream ALMs with detailed attack and defense analyses.
